channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13128] Make HBCK's lock file retry creation and deletion
item.description:
When hbck runs it creates a lock file to ensure that no two hbck instances are running. We've been seeing creating and removing that file fail sometimes.
This improvement should make the creation, closing of the file, and the deletion retry multiple times. This should allow our alerting which uses this command to be more reliable and have fewer false positives.
item.summary: Make HBCK's lock file retry creation and deletion

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: on Hadoop 2.6.0+, we'll already block and wait to create this file for ~5 minutes. (see HBASE-12607). Would updating your HDFS version work for your case?
This is all about removing the file. The call to HDFS can fail and throw an error. That will leave the lock file since there's no retires.

mind if I rename to scope it to just the delete?

do we have some stack traces of the failures? would like some idea of what the transient error looks like.
Since we are working with the older version of hadoop we also need to have the retries for creation.
Added retries for creation and deletion of the lock file.

I have added retries for both creation and deletion of the lock file.
The default number of attempts is set to 5 with the initial sleep time between the attempts set to 200 msec.

working with the older version of hadoop

Which version of hadoop are you using ?


387	          } catch (InterruptedException ie) {

388	            throw (InterruptedIOException) new InterruptedIOException(

389	                "Can't create lock file").initCause(ie);

Please add path to lock file in exception message.

This message is automatically generated.

+ private static final int MAX_LOCK_FILE_ATTEMPTS = 5;
+ private static final int LOCK_FILE_ATTEMPT_SLEEP_INTERVAL = 200;

can we name these DEFAULT_

+ LOG.info("Failed to create lock file " + hbckLockFilePath.getName()
+ + ", try=" + (retryCounter.getAttemptTimes() + 1) + " of "
+ + retryCounter.getMaxAttempts());
+ LOG.debug(ioe);

Please include a note in the debug message that the ioe is details from the failure to create the lock file.

  • FileLockCallable callable = new FileLockCallable();
    + RetryCounter retryCounter = lockFileRetryCounterFactory.create();

nit: whitespace error

+ LOG.warn("Failed to delete " + HBCK_LOCK_PATH + ", try="
+ + (retryCounter.getAttemptTimes() + 1) + " of "
+ + retryCounter.getMaxAttempts());
+ LOG.debug(ioe);

Keep the main message at INFO, to match the creation. Is th

Please include a note in the debug message that the ioe is details about failing to delete the lock file.

+ // If we reach here, then an exception was caught
+ if (fail) fail();

Please assertFalse and include a message instead of the comment.

+ /**
+ * This test makes sure that parallel instances of Hbck is disabled.
+ *
+ * @throws Exception
+ */

The asserts at the end don't line up with this description. Don't we want one of them to fail? Or are we trying to test that with retries 15 seconds is long enough for the second instance to wait out the first?

+ // Both should be successful
+ assertNotNull(h1);
+ assertNotNull(h2);
+ assert(h1.getRetCode() >= 0);
+ assert(h2.getRetCode() >= 0);
+
Fixed after the review.
The last test is supposed to make sure that both instances run successfully with retries - I have changed the description and modified the test a bit.

This looks good Victoria. One last thing:


+      do {

+        try {

+          IOUtils.closeStream(hbckOutFd);

+          FSUtils.delete(FSUtils.getCurrentFileSystem(getConf()),

+              HBCK_LOCK_PATH, true);

+          return;

+        } catch (IOException ioe) {

+          LOG.info("Failed to delete " + HBCK_LOCK_PATH + ", try="

+              + (retryCounter.getAttemptTimes() + 1) + " of "

+              + retryCounter.getMaxAttempts());

+          LOG.debug("Failed to delete " + HBCK_LOCK_PATH, ioe);

+          try {

+            retryCounter.sleepUntilNextRetry();

+          } catch (InterruptedException ie) {

+            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();

+            LOG.warn("Interrupted while deleting lock file" +

+                HBCK_LOCK_PATH);

+            return;

+          }

+        }

+      } while (retryCounter.shouldRetry());

Could you break this into a retry block for each of closing and deleting per Elliot's request above?

Otherwise, +1 lgtm

Sorry Sean Busbey that's on me. Victoria came by my desk, and we looked at the patch in person. IOUtils.closeStream actually un-conditionally catches IO exceptions so it won't ever throw and there's no reason to put it into it's own try/catch.

This message is automatically generated.
the javadoc warning wasn't this ticket. tracking down the checkstyle one now.

please fix these two checkstyle errors:

<file name="/Users/busbey/projects/hbase-priority/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/util/HBaseFsck.java">

<error line="202" column="63" severity="error" message="File contains tab characters (this is the first instance)." source="com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace.FileTabCharacterCheck"/>

<error line="321" severity="error" message="Line is longer than 100 characters (found 122)." source="com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.sizes.LineLengthCheck"/>

The tab warning only prints for the first occurrence, so you should check for more tabs elsewhere in the patch.

Fixed the tab character style error. Regarding the long line - its long because parameter name is long - I think splitting the statement to multi-line will make it less straightforward. I can assign variable to the value of the parameter and then use it - let me know if this is really needed.
that sounds like a reasonable approach.
+1 I'll clean those two lines on commit.
Pushed to branch-1 and master.
